$schema.description: Ignored. Can be set to get completions, validations and documentation in some editors.

alias.description: Aliases that will get assigned when the deployment is `READY` and the target is `production`. The client needs to make a `GET` request to its API to ensure the assignment

build.description: An object containing another object with information to be passed to the Build Process

env.description: An object containing the deployment's environment variable names and values to be passed to Builds. Secrets can be referenced by prefixing the value with `@`

builds.description: A list of build descriptions whose src references valid source files.

config.description: Optionally, an object including arbitrary metadata to be passed to the Builder

src.description: A glob expression or pathname. If more than one file is resolved, one build will be created per matched file. It can include `*` and `**`

use.description: An npm module to be installed by the build process. It can include a semver compatible version (e.g.: `@org/proj@1`)

cleanUrls.description: When set to `true`, all HTML files and Serverless Functions will have their extension removed. When visiting a path that ends with the extension, a 308 response will redirect the client to the extensionless path.

env.description: An object containing the deployment's environment variable names and values. Secrets can be referenced by prefixing the value with `@`

passiveRegions.description: An array of the passive regions the deployment's Serverless Functions should be deployed to that can be failed over to during a lambda outage

functionFailoverRegions.description: Same as passiveRegions. An array of the passive regions the deployment's Serverless Functions should be deployed to so we can failover to these regions on lambda outages

functions.description: An object describing custom options for your Serverless Functions. Each key must be glob pattern that matches the paths of the Serverless Functions you would like to customize (like `api/*.js` or `api/test.js`).

excludeFiles.description: A glob pattern to match files that should be excluded from your Serverless Function. If you’re using a Community Runtime, the behavior might vary.

includeFiles.description: A glob pattern to match files that should be included in your Serverless Function. If you’re using a Community Runtime, the behavior might vary.

maxDuration.description: An integer defining how long your Serverless Function should be allowed to run on every request in seconds (between 1 and the maximum limit of your plan).

memory.description: An integer defining the memory your Serverless Function should be provided with (between 128 and 10240).

runtime.description: The npm package name of a Runtime, including its version

supportsCancellation.description: A boolean that defines whether the Function supports cancellation (default: false)

experimentalTriggers.description: An array of experimental triggers for this Serverless Function. Currently only supports queue triggers.

type.description: Event type pattern this trigger handles

topic.description: Name of the queue topic to consume from

consumer.description: Name of the consumer group for this trigger

retryAfterSeconds.description: Delay in seconds before retrying failed executions

initialDelaySeconds.description: Initial delay in seconds before first execution attempt

maxConcurrency.description: Maximum number of concurrent executions for this consumer

deploymentEnabled.description: Specifies the branches that will not trigger an auto-deployment when committing to them. Any non specified branch is `true` by default.

exclusivity.description: If specified, the git repository will be exclusive to the specificed Team IDs. Teams that are not specified in the list will not be able to link new projects or create new deployments.

teams.description: A list of allowed Team IDs.

autoAlias.description: When set to `false`, Vercel for GitHub will not deploy the given project regardless of the GitHub app being installed.

autoJobCancelation.description: When set to `false`, Vercel for GitHub will always build pushes in sequence without cancelling a build for the most recent commit.

enabled.description: When set to false, Vercel for GitHub will not apply the alias upon merge.

silent.description: [deprecated] Please use the Project Settings in the dashboard instead: https://vercel.link/46vERTS When set to `true`, Vercel for GitHub will stop commenting on pull requests and commits.

source.description: A pattern that matches each incoming pathname (excluding querystring)

headers.description: An array of key/value pairs representing each response header.

has.description: An array of requirements that are needed to match

type.description: The type of request element to check

value.description: A value to match against. Can be a string (regex) or a condition operation object

anyOf.description: A regular expression used to match thev value. Named groups can be used in the destination.
A condition operation object

key.description: The name of the element contained in the particular type

value.description: A value to match against. Can be a string (regex) or a condition operation object

A condition operation object

missing.description: An array of requirements that are needed to match

public.description: Whether a deployment's source and logs are available publicly

source.description: A pattern that matches each incoming pathname (excluding querystring).

destination.description: A location destination defined as an absolute pathname or external URL.

permanent.description: A boolean to toggle between permanent and temporary redirect. When `true`, the status code is `308`. When `false` the status code is `307`.

statusCode.description: An optional integer to define the status code of the redirect.

bulkRedirectsPath.description: The path to a file containing bulk redirects; supports JSON, JSONL, and CSV

regions.description: An array of the regions the deployment's Serverless Functions should be deployed to

statusCode.description: An optional integer to override the status code of the response.

env.description: An array of environment variable names that should be replaced at runtime in the destination

respectOriginCacheControl.description: When set to true (default), external rewrites will respect the Cache-Control header from the origin. When false, caching is disabled for this rewrite.

routes.description: A list of routes objects used to rewrite paths to point towards other internal or external paths

value.description: A value to match against. Can be a string (regex) or a condition operation object

A condition operation object

mitigate.description: Mitigation action to take on a route

transforms.description: A list of transform rules to adjust the query parameters of a request or HTTP headers of request or response

type.description: The scope of the transform to apply

op.description: The operation to perform on the target

key.description: A value to match against. Can be a string or a condition operation object (without regex support)

anyOf.description: A valid header name (letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores)
A condition operation object

env.description: An array of environment variable names that should be replaced at runtime in the args value
An array of environment variable names that should be replaced at runtime in the destination or headers

respectOriginCacheControl.description: When set to true (default), external rewrites will respect the Cache-Control header from the origin. When false, caching is disabled for this rewrite.

scope.description: This property determines the scope (user or team) under which the project will be deployed by Vercel CLI.

trailingSlash.description: When `false`, visiting a path that ends with a forward slash will respond with a `308` status code and redirect to the path without the trailing slash.

buildCommand.description: The build command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

devCommand.description: The dev command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

framework.description: The framework that is being used for this project. When `null` is used no framework is selected

installCommand.description: The install command for this project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

outputDirectory.description: The output directory of the project. When `null` is used this value will be automatically detected

crons.description: An array of cron jobs that should be created for production Deployments.

relatedProjects.description: An array of projectIds to associate with the current project.

fluid.description: Enables Fluid compute for the project. It's enabled by default for new projects.

bunVersion.description: Enables Bun for the project and specifies the version to use.

experimentalServices.description: Enables configuration of multiple services in a single deployment. Map of service name to service configuration.

type.description: Service type: web, cron, or worker. Defaults to web.

entrypoint.description: Entry file for the service, relative to the workspace directory.

workspace.description: Path to the directory containing the service manifest file (package.json, pyproject.toml, etc.). Defaults to "." (project root).

routePrefix.description: URL prefix for routing (web services only).

runtime.description: Specific lambda runtime to use, e.g. nodejs24.x, python3.14.

schedule.description: Cron schedule expression (e.g., "0 0 * * *"). Required for cron services.

consumer.description: Consumer group name for worker subscription.

experimentalServiceGroups.description: Enables grouping of services. Map of service group name to an array of service names belonging to that group.
